sources.title: If Cats Could Sing (1950)
sources.description: Opera-singing alley cats. Just about every element that spells 'Terrytoon' is on display (including a bouquet of Tyer). Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/if-cats-could-sing-1950/

metadata.Plot: I thought this cartoon is a very nice, completely enjoyable little musical from Paul Terry, that is now another favorite. Also I meant this in a good way, that it's so campy, it's wonderfully goofy.They story is basically an operatic take on a cat "singing" to a female. But her annoyed, sleep-deprived owner tries to keep her away from him. Well in the beginning, every cat in the city is going to a kitty-cat opera and the female lead wanted to go, but her owner confines her inside.So that is all I have to say about this cartoon, and that I love this cartoon way better than the Warner Bros. cartoon "Notes to You" and its color remake "Back Alley Oproar." Overall, I love this cartoon - campiness and all.
metadata.Writer: Bob Kuwahara, Tom Morrison, Paul Terry
